alert.note: Alert for Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 01 at 9:38PM AKST until March 03 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow with reduced visibility expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 inches. Blowing snow reducing visibility to one half mile or less at times Thursday and Thursday night. Northwest winds 15 mph gusting to 25 mph on Thursday and Thursday night. * WHERE...Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country. * WHEN...Until 6 AM AKST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will continue through Friday morning, with the heaviest snow tonight. Northwest winds will increase to 15 mph gusting to 25 mph by early Thursday and continue into Friday morning. These winds will cause low visibility in blowing snow from early Thursday through early Friday.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country
